qas.question: What plan of 1811 spread a grid of streets across Manhattan?
In what year did the Erie Canal finish building?
What political machine controlled New York politics in this era?
Along with German immigrants, immigrants of what nationality supported Tammany Hall?
The Erie Canal was finished being built in what year?

context: In the 19th century, the city was transformed by development relating to its status as a trading center, as well as by European immigration. The city adopted the <a0_0>Commissioners' Plan<a0_0/> of 1811, which expanded the city street grid to encompass all of Manhattan. The <a1_0><a4_0>1825<a4_0/><a1_0/> completion of the Erie Canal through central New York connected the Atlantic port to the agricultural markets and commodities of the North American interior via the Hudson River and the Great Lakes. Local politics became dominated by <a2_0>Tammany Hall<a2_0/>, a political machine supported by <a3_0>Irish<a3_0/> and German immigrants.
